name: Philodendron Paraiso Verde
climate: Philodendron Paraiso Verde thrives best in a warm and tropical climate.
High humidity is essential for the plant's growth and well-being.
The plant prefers temperatures ranging between 65°F to 80°F.
It does not fare well in cold climates or places with drafts.
sunlight: The plant enjoys bright, indirect sunlight to maintain its foliage.
Direct sunlight can harm the leaves, causing them to burn.
A position near an east-facing window is often ideal for this plant.
Low light can slow the growth and reduce the leaf variegation.
watering: Water the plant when the top inch of the soil is dry to the touch.
Overwatering can cause root rot, which is detrimental to the plant.
Maintaining evenly moist soil without waterlogging is crucial.
In winter, reduce watering slightly to prevent excess moisture.
soil: A well-draining soil mix is necessary to prevent water retention.
A mixture of peat moss, perlite, and potting soil is recommended.
Aeration in the soil helps promote healthy root development.
Ensure the pot has adequate drainage holes to prevent standing water.
toxic: Philodendron Paraiso Verde is toxic to pets if ingested.
The plant contains calcium oxalate crystals, harmful to humans.
extra_care_tip: Wipe the leaves occasionally to remove dust and promote photosynthesis.
Regularly rotate the plant to encourage even growth on all sides.
